summary: This is an evidence custody document from the Office of the Inspector General, U.S. Department of Justice, detailing the seizure of phone log printouts and 30-minute rounds logs from the BOP MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center) on August 22, 2019. The document records the chain of custody for evidence related to case NYFO 2019-010614, likely connected to the investigation following Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

events.title: Evidence Seizure at BOP MCC
events.description: Special agents seized phone log printouts for specific extensions and 30-minute rounds logs covering July 1 to August 10, 2019, from the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

locations: BOP MCC (Bureau of Prisons Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Evidence was seized from the BOP Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 22, 2019, under case number NYFO 2019-010614.
The seized property includes phone log printouts for specific extensions (6314, 6313, 6468, 6385, 6317) and logs of 30-minute rounds from July 1 to August 10, 2019.
The document is an official evidence custody record from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General, indicating a formal investigation into activities or procedures at the correctional facility.
The timing of the seizure (August 22, 2019) is shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the MCC on August 10, 2019, suggesting the evidence is related to the investigation into his death.
